newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UBS cuts rates on 4-8 year cash bonds.
newsitem.headline: UBS cuts rates on 4-8 year cash bonds.

text.p: Union Bank of Switzerland (UBS) said it was lowering the rates it pays on four through eight-year cash bonds (kassenobligationen) by one-quarter percentage point, effective January 16.
The rate on four-year bonds was lowered to 2-3/4 percent, five-year bonds to 3.00 percent, six year bonds will pay 3-1/4 percent, seven year bonds 3-1/2 percent and eight year bonds 3-3/4 percent.
The rate on two-year bonds remains steady at 2.00 percent as well as the rate on three year bonds of 2-1/2 percent.
Cash bonds, fixed-rate deposits for small investors, are used by banks to help finance their mortgage lending.
